subject: small help please for junit beginner
msgSnippet: Hi, I have downloaded junit framework. I m using Windows98. I have created a directory newd in C and unzipped junit3.6.zip. I have added set
messageBody:
Hi,
I have downloaded junit framework. I'm using
Windows98. I have created a directory newd in C and
unzipped junit3.6.zip.
I have added set CLASSPATH=c:\newd\junit.jar in the
autoexec.bat and started the TestRunner tool in
c:\newd.
I have tried the following Money class:

class Money {
private int fAmount;
private String fCurrency;
public Money(int amount, String currency) {
fAmount= amount;
fCurrency= currency; }
public Money add(Money m) {
return new Money(amount()+m.amount(),currency());
}
public int amount() { return fAmount; }
public String currency() { return fCurrency; }
public boolean equals(Object anObject) {
if (!(anObject instanceof Money))
return false;
Money aMoney= (Money)anObject;
return aMoney.currency().equals
(currency()) && amount() ==
aMoney.amount(); }
}

I have the MoneyTest class as follows:

import junit.framework.*;
public class MoneyTest extends TestCase {
private Money f12CHF;
private Money f14CHF;
protected void setUp() {
f12CHF= new Money(12, "CHF");
f14CHF= new Money(14, "CHF"); }
public void testMoneyEquals() {
assert(!f12CHF.equals(null));
Money equalMoney= new Money(12, "CHF");
assertEquals(f12CHF, f12CHF);
assertEquals(f12CHF, new Money(12,"CHF"));
assert(!f12CHF.equals(f14CHF)); }
public void testSimpleAdd() {
Money expected= new Money(26, "CHF");
Money
result=f12CHF.add(f14CHF);
assert(expected.equals(result)); }
public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite=new
TestSuite();
suite.addTest(new
MoneyTest("testMoneyEquals");
suite.addTest(new
MoneyTest("testSimpleAdd");
return suite; }
}


I have the follwoing problems and questions:
1. Do I have to compile Money and MoneyTest class
manually or the tool does this for me?
2. When I have tried to compile MoneyTest, the
following error appears:
package junit.framework.*; does not exist.
How can I solve this problem. I though that it is
enaough to set the class path to the junit.jar in the
autoexec.bat.
3. When I write MoneyTest in the TestRunner class
field and click Run button, a message "class not found
"MoneyTest" ". Is it because the MoneyTest class not
compiled, or there is another reason?

Thanks .. Jehad
